p: That from my best information the alleged facts relating to the formidible out of which said action grew, are not generally known to the people of said precinct and that they generally have not formed an opinion as to the guilt or innocence of said defendant, and that the people of said precinct are not prejudiced against said Ray Raymond applicant further said that there are about four hundred people living in said Peone precinct and that applicant verily believes that a large number of good unprejudiced and loyally qualified jurors can be summoned and because in said precinct & serve as jurors in said action. An further applicant saith not.
Subscribed and sowrn ro before me this tenth day of December A.D. 1886
